 35 -class OrientationFilter(object): 

 36      """ 
 37      Base class for orientation estimation filters. 
 38   
 39      An orientation filter takes accelerometer, magnetometer and gyroscope 
 40      readings from an IMU and attempts to track the orientation of the IMU 
 41      as a L{Quaternion} from these measurements. 
 42   
 43      @ivar rotation: L{TimeSeries} of quaternion orientation estimates. 
 44      """ 
 45   
 46      __metaclass__ = ABCMeta 
 47   

 48 -    def __init__(self, initialTime, initialRotation): 

 49          """ 
 50          Initialise orientation filter. 
 51   
 52          @param initialTime: Initial time. 
 53          @param initialRotation: Initial rotation (L{Quaternion}). 
 54          """ 
 55          assert isinstance(initialRotation, Quaternion) 
 56          self.rotation = TimeSeries() 

 57   

 58 -    def __call__(self, accel, mag, gyro, t): 

 59          """ 
 60          Run filter update. 
 61   
 62          @param accel: Accelerometer sample (3x1 L{np.ndarray}) 
 63          @param mag: Magnetometer sample (3x1 L{np.ndarray}) 
 64          @param gyro: Gyroscope sample (3x1 L{np.ndarray}) 
 65          @param t: Time at which samples were taken. 
 66          """ 
 67          dt = t - self.rotation.latestTime 
 68          self._update(accel, mag, gyro, dt, t) 

 69   
 70      @abstractmethod 

 71 -    def _update(self, accel, mag, gyro, dt, t): 

 72          """ 
 73          Internal filter update routine. 
 74   
 75          Should add its results to the self.rotation L{TimeSeries}. 
 76          """ 
 77          pass

 80      """ 
 81      An estimator that obtains its orientation using only gyroscope integration. 
 82      """

 84 -    def __init__(self, initialTime, initialRotation, **kwargs):

 87          self.qHat = initialRotation.copy() 

 88   

 89 -    def _update(self, accel, mag, gyro, dt, t): 

 90          dotq = 0.5 * self.qHat * Quaternion(0, *gyro) 
 91          self.qHat += dotq * dt 
 92          self.qHat.normalise() 
 93          self.rotation.add(t, self.qHat)

 95 -class BachmannCF(OrientationFilter): 

 96      """ 
 97      Implementation of the complementary filter algorithm proposed by Bachmann. 
 98   
 99      See E. R. Bachmann. "Inertial and Magnetic Tracking of Limb Segment 
100      Orientation for Inserting Humans into Synthetic Environments". PhD thesis, 
101      Naval Postgraduate School, California, 2000. 
102   
103      @ivar vectorObservation: L{TimeSeries} of vector observation results. 
104      """ 
105   
106      @prepend_method_doc(OrientationFilter) 

107 -    def __init__(self, initialTime, initialRotation, k, **kwargs): 

108          """ 
109          @param k: Filter blending co-efficient (float). At each timestep, a 
110              correction will be applied of M{1/k} times the difference between 
111              the gyro integration and vector observation results. 
112          """ 
113          OrientationFilter.__init__(self, initialTime, initialRotation) 
114          self.rotation.add(initialTime, initialRotation) 
115          self._k = float(k) 
116          self.qHat = initialRotation.copy() 
117          self._vectorObservation = vector_observation.FQA() 
118          self.vectorObservation = TimeSeries() 

119   

120 -    def _update(self, accel, mag, gyro, dt, t): 

121          dotq = 0.5 * self.qHat * Quaternion(0, *gyro) 
122          self.qHat += dotq * dt 
123          qMeas = self._vectorObservation(-accel, mag) 
124          if self.qHat.dot(qMeas) < 0: 
125              qMeas.negate() 
126          qError = qMeas - self.qHat 
127          self.qHat += (1/self._k) * dt * qError 
128          self.qHat.normalise() 
129          self.vectorObservation.add(t, qMeas) 
130          self.rotation.add(t, self.qHat) 

131   

132 -class OrientCF(OrientationFilter): 

133      """ 
134      Implementation of the complementary filter used on the Orient IMU. 
135   
136      See A. Young, M. Ling, and D. K. Arvind. "Orient-2: A Realtime Wireless 
137      Posture Tracking System using Local Orientation Estimation". in Proc. 
138      4th Workshop on Embedded Network Sensors, pp 53-57. ACM, 2007. 
139   
140      @ivar vectorObservation: L{TimeSeries} of vector observation results. 
141      """ 
142   
143      @prepend_method_doc(BachmannCF) 

144 -    def __init__(self, initialTime, initialRotation, k, aT, **kwargs): 

145          """ 
146          @param aT: acceleration threshold (float). The correction step will 
147              only be performed if the condition M{abs(norm(accel) - 1) <= aT} 
148              is met. 
149          """ 
150          OrientationFilter.__init__(self, initialTime, initialRotation) 
151          self.rotation.add(initialTime, initialRotation) 
152          self._k = float(k) 
153          self._aT = float(aT) 
154          self.qHat = initialRotation.copy() 
155          self._vectorObservation = vector_observation.GramSchmidt() 
156          self.vectorObservation = TimeSeries() 

157   

158 -    def _update(self, accel, mag, gyro, dt, t): 

159          dotq = 0.5 * self.qHat * Quaternion(0,*gyro) 
160          self.qHat += dotq * dt 
161   
162          if abs(vectors.norm(accel) - 1) < self._aT: 
163              qMeas = self._vectorObservation(-accel, mag) 
164              if self.qHat.dot(qMeas) < 0: 
165                  qMeas.negate() 
166              qError = qMeas - self.qHat 
167              self.qHat += (1/self._k) * dt * qError 
168          else: 
169              qMeas = Quaternion.nan() 
170          self.vectorObservation.add(t, qMeas) 
171   
172          self.qHat.normalise() 
173          self.rotation.add(t, self.qHat)

175 -class YunEKF(OrientationFilter): 

176      """ 
177      Implementation of the extented Kalman filter proposed by Yun et al. 
178   
179      See X. Yun and E. R. Bachmann. "Design, Implementation, and Experiemental 
180      Results of a Quaternion-Based Kalman Filter for Human Body Motion 
181      Tracking". IEEE Transactions on Robotics, vol 22, no 6, pp 1216-1227, 2006. 
182   
183      @ivar vectorObservation: L{TimeSeries} of vector observation results. 
184      @ivar rotationalVelocity: L{TimeSeries} of angular rate estimates. 
185      """ 
186   
187      @prepend_method_doc(OrientationFilter) 

188 -    def __init__(self, initialTime, initialRotation, initialRotationalVelocity, 
189              initialCovariance, measurementCovariance, D, tau, **kwargs): 

190          """ 
191          @param initialRotationalVelocity: Initial angular rate estimate 
192              (3x1 L{np.ndarray}). 
193          @param initialCovariance: Initial state covariance matrix (7x7). 
194          @param measurementCovariance: Measurement noise covariance (7x7). 
195          @param D: Variance of process noise model in rad^2/s^2 (float). 
196          @param tau: Time constant of process noise model in seconds (float). 
197          """ 
198          OrientationFilter.__init__(self, initialTime, initialRotation) 
199          self.rotation.add(initialTime, initialRotation, initialCovariance[3:,3:]) 
200   
201          self.tau = float(tau) 
202          self.D = float(D) 
203   
204          self._vectorObservation = vector_observation.FQA() 
205   
206          # Process noise covariance matrix, updated on each call. 
207          self.Q = np.asmatrix(np.zeros((7,7))) 
208   
209          # Measurement noise covariance matrix 
210          self.R = measurementCovariance 
211   
212          # Prior covariance estimate and state vector initialisation. 
213          self.P_minus = initialCovariance 
214          self.xHat_minus = np.vstack((initialRotationalVelocity, 
215              np.vstack(initialRotation.components))) 
216   
217          self.vectorObservation = TimeSeries() 
218          self.rotationalVelocity = TimeSeries() 

219   

220 -    def _update(self, accel, mag, gyro, dt, t): 

221          # Note: Measurement matrix H is equivalent to the identity matrix 
222          # so is left out to simplify calculations 
223   
224          # Calculate Kalman gain 
225          K = self.P_minus * np.linalg.inv(self.P_minus + self.R) 
226   
227          # Construct measurment vector z 
228          self.vo = self._vectorObservation(-accel, mag) 
229          if self.vo.dot(Quaternion(*self.xHat_minus[3:])) < 0: 
230              self.vo.negate() 
231          z = np.vstack((gyro, np.vstack(self.vo.components))) 
232   
233          # Calculate state update 
234          xHat = self.xHat_minus + K * (z - self.xHat_minus) 
235          P = (np.eye(7) - K) * self.P_minus 
236   
237          # Normalise quaternion component of state vector 
238          qHat = Quaternion(*xHat[3:]).normalise() 
239          xHat[3:] = np.vstack(qHat.components) 
240   
241          # Calculate prediction 
242          self.xHat_minus = xHat + self.dotx(xHat) * dt 
243          Phi = self.Phi(xHat, dt) 
244          self.Q[[0,1,2],[0,1,2]] = \ 
245              (self.D / (2 * self.tau)) * (1 - math.e**((-2 * dt) / self.tau)) 
246          self.P_minus = Phi * P * Phi.T + self.Q 
247   
248          self.rotation.add(t, qHat, P[3:,3:]) 
249          self.vectorObservation.add(t, self.vo) 
250          self.rotationalVelocity.add(t, xHat[:3], P[:3,:3]) 

251   

252 -    def dotx(self, xHat): 

253          """ 
254          Calculate state derivative vector. 
255          """ 
256          dotx = np.empty((7, 1)) 
257          dotx[:3] = -xHat[:3] / self.tau 
258          dotx[3] = -0.5 * (xHat[0]*xHat[4] + xHat[1]*xHat[5] + xHat[2]*xHat[6]) 
259          dotx[4] = 0.5 * (xHat[0]*xHat[3] - xHat[1]*xHat[6] +xHat[2]*xHat[5]) 
260          dotx[5] = 0.5 * (xHat[0]*xHat[6] + xHat[1]*xHat[3] - xHat[2]*xHat[4]) 
261          dotx[6] = 0.5 * (-xHat[0]*xHat[5] +xHat[1]*xHat[4] + xHat[2]*xHat[3]) 
262          return dotx 

263   

264 -    def Phi(self, xHat, dt): 

265          """ 
266          Calculate discrete state transition matrix Phi. 
267          """ 
268          # Note: Yun paper matrix element indices are one-based so subtract 1 
269          # from all for zero-based indices. 
270          Phi = np.eye(7) 
271          Phi[0,0] = math.e**(-dt / self.tau) 
272          Phi[1,1] = math.e**(-dt / self.tau) 
273          Phi[2,2] = math.e**(-dt / self.tau) 
274   
275          Phi[3,0] = -xHat[4] * dt / 2 
276          Phi[3,1] = -xHat[5] * dt / 2 
277          Phi[3,2] = -xHat[6] * dt / 2 
278          Phi[3,4] = -xHat[0] * dt / 2 
279          Phi[3,5] = -xHat[1] * dt / 2 
280          Phi[3,6] = -xHat[2] * dt / 2 
281   
282          Phi[4,0] = xHat[3] * dt / 2 
283          Phi[4,1] = -xHat[6] * dt / 2 
284          Phi[4,2] = xHat[5] * dt / 2 
285          Phi[4,2] = xHat[0] * dt / 2 
286          Phi[4,5] = xHat[2] * dt / 2 
287          Phi[4,6] = -xHat[1] * dt / 2 
288   
289          Phi[5,0] = xHat[6] * dt / 2 
290          Phi[5,1] = xHat[3] * dt / 2 
291          Phi[5,2] = -xHat[4] * dt / 2 
292          Phi[5,3] = xHat[1] * dt / 2 
293          Phi[5,4] = -xHat[2] * dt / 2 
294          Phi[5,6] = xHat[0] * dt / 2 
295   
296          Phi[6,0] = -xHat[5] * dt / 2 
297          Phi[6,1] = xHat[4] * dt / 2 
298          Phi[6,2] = xHat[3] * dt / 2 
299          Phi[6,3] = xHat[2] * dt / 2 
300          Phi[6,4] = xHat[1] * dt / 2 
301          Phi[6,5] = -xHat[0] * dt / 2 
302   
303          return Phi

305 -class DistLinAccelCF(OrientationFilter): 

306      """ 
307      Implementation of the multi-IMU orientation algorithm by Young & Ling. 
308   
309      See A. D. Young, M. J. Ling and D. K. Arvind. "Distributed Estimation of 
310      Linear Acceleration for Improved Accuracy in Wireless Inertial Motion 
311      Capture", in Proc. 9th ACM/IEEE International Conference on Information 
312      Processing in Sensor Networks, ACM, 2010, pp. 256-267. 
313   
314      @ivar qMeas: Result of latest vector observation (L{Quaternion}). 
315      @ivar vectorObservation: L{TimeSeries} of vector observation results. 
316      @ivar jointAccel: Latest estimate of joint acceleration 
317          (3x1 L{np.ndarray}). 
318      @ivar jointAcceleration: L{TimeSeries} of acceleration estimates. 
319      """ 
320      GRAVITY_VECTOR = vectors.vector(0, 0, STANDARD_GRAVITY) 
321   
322      @prepend_method_doc(BachmannCF) 

323 -    def __init__(self, initialTime, initialRotation, k, joint, offset, 
324              **kwargs): 

325          """ 
326          @param joint: The L{Joint} the IMU is attached to. 
327          @param offset: The offset of the IMU in the joint's co-ordinate frame 
328              (3x1 L{np.ndarray}) 
329          """ 
330          OrientationFilter.__init__(self, initialTime, initialRotation) 
331          self.rotation.add(initialTime, initialRotation) 
332          self.qHat = initialRotation.copy() 
333          self.k = k 
334          self.joint = joint 
335          self.offset = offset 
336   
337          self._vectorObservation = vector_observation.GramSchmidt() 
338          self.qMeas = Quaternion.nan() 
339          self.jointAccel = vectors.nan() 
340   
341          self.gyroFIFO = collections.deque([], maxlen=3) 
342          self.accelFIFO = collections.deque([], maxlen=2) 
343          self.magFIFO = collections.deque([], maxlen=2) 
344   
345          self.isRoot = not joint.hasParent 
346          self.children = joint.childJoints 
347   
348          self.vectorObservation = TimeSeries() 
349          self.jointAcceleration = TimeSeries() 

350   

351 -    def handleLinearAcceleration(self, jointAcceleration, dt): 

352          """ 
353          Perform drift correction based on incoming joint acceleration estimate. 
354   
355          @param jointAcceleration: Acceleration estimate (3x1 L{np.ndarray}). 
356          """ 
357          self.jointAccel = jointAcceleration 
358   
359          if len(self.gyroFIFO) < 3: 
360              return 
361   
362          # Estimate linear acceleration 
363          o = self.offset 
364          w = self.gyroFIFO 
365          q = self.qHat_minus_1 
366          a = (w[0] - w[2]) / (2 * dt) 
367          lt = vectors.cross(a, o) 
368          lr = vectors.dot(w[1], o) * w[1] - o * vectors.norm(w[1])**2 
369          l = (q.rotateFrame(self.jointAccel) + lt + lr) 
370   
371          # Apply drift correction 
372          self.qMeas = self._vectorObservation(-(self.accelFIFO[1]- l), 
373                  self.magFIFO[1]) 
374          if q.dot(self.qMeas) < 0: 
375              self.qMeas.negate() 
376          q = q + 1.0/self.k * dt * (self.qMeas - q) 
377          dotq = 0.5 * self.qHat * Quaternion(0,*w[0]) 
378          self.qHat = q + dotq * dt 
379          self.qHat.normalise() 

380   

381 -    def childAcceleration(self, o, dt): 

382          """ 
383          Compute acceleration for child joint. 
384   
385          @param o: Offset of child joint (3x1 L{np.ndarray}). 
386          """ 
387          w = self.gyroFIFO 
388          if len(w) < 3: 
389              return None 
390          q = self.qHat_minus_1 
391          a = (w[0] - w[2]) / (2 * dt) 
392          lt = vectors.cross(a, o) 
393          lr = vectors.dot(w[1], o) * w[1] - o * vectors.norm(w[1])**2 
394          l = self.jointAccel + q.rotateVector(lt + lr) 
395          return l 

396   

397 -    def _update(self, accel, mag, gyro, dt, t): 

398          # Store measurements in queues for processing 
399          self.gyroFIFO.appendleft(gyro) 
400          self.accelFIFO.appendleft(accel) 
401          self.magFIFO.appendleft(mag) 
402   
403          # save current qHat for drift correction 
404          self.qHat_minus_1 = copy.copy(self.qHat) 
405   
406          # Inertial update 
407          dotq = 0.5 * self.qHat * Quaternion(0,*gyro) 
408          self.qHat += dotq * dt 
409          self.qHat.normalise() 
410   
411          if self.isRoot and len(self.accelFIFO) >= 2: 
412              # Root can't receive acceleration data so must estimate it. 
413              measuredAccel = self.qHat_minus_1.rotateVector(self.accelFIFO[1]) 
414              # Assume root joint acceleration was zero. 
415              self.jointAccel = np.zeros((3,1)) 
416              # Calculate tangential acceleration for root joint IMU offset. 
417              linAccel = self.childAcceleration(self.offset, dt) 
418              if linAccel is not None: 
419                  # Calculate expected measurement. 
420                  expectedAccel = linAccel - self.GRAVITY_VECTOR 
421                  # Set root joint acceleration to the residual. 
422                  self.jointAccel = measuredAccel - expectedAccel 
423                  self.handleLinearAcceleration(self.jointAccel, dt) 
424   
425          self.rotation.add(t, self.qHat) 
426          self.vectorObservation.add(t, self.qMeas) 
427          self.jointAcceleration.add(t, self.jointAccel)
